alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 4:04PM EST until December 20 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of East Central, North Central, and Northern Maine, including the following counties, in East Central Maine, Penobscot. In North Central Maine, Piscataquis. In Northern Maine, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 404 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenville, Patten, Mount Katahdin, Ripogenus, Smyrna, Mount Chase, Baxter State Park, South Branch Pond, Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument, Telos Lake, Moosehorn Crossing, Shin Pond, Chesuncook, Lobster Township, Frenchtown, Lobster Lake, Kokadjo, Northeast Carry, Smyrna Mills and Dudley Township. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
